body.p: In the tree, every package has a Manifest file. This file lives in the same directory as the ebuilds for the package. The Manifest file contains digests (currently MD5) and file size data for every file in the directory and any subdirectories. This is used to verify integrity.
The Manifest may be digitally signed.

Inside the files/ subdirectory, there is exactly one digest file per ebuild. Each file contains a digest (currently MD5) and a file size for every file listed in SRC_URI for the ebuild. This is used to verify downloads and to catch any changed source files.

When generating digests, it is necessary to include all of the files which could be downloaded (SRC_URI can contain conditional entries). Portage will do this automatically if cvs is included in FEATURES.

To generate digests and Manifest, use ebuild foo.ebuild digest. When committing, the Manifest file must be regenerated to handle any CVS keyword expansion changes -- repoman will do this automatically.
